    MAT 7404 - Statistical Methods
    Data summarization and display, distributions; binomial, Poisson, normal, t, chi-square and F, estimation, hypothesis testing, linear regression, correlation, statistical software packages.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7405 - Statistical Methods II
    ANOVA: multiple comparison procedures, contrasts, random and fixed effect models, transformations, experimental design, nested designs, randomized blocks, factorials, latin squares, analysis of covariance, multiple regression, correlation, statistical software packages.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Engineering, Graduate Nursing, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7500 - Statistical Programming
    Use SAS and R for data manipulation, presentation, and summarization. Topics include inputting/importing/exporting data cleaning and manipulation, and numerical and graphical summaries/analyses. Students will be introduced to simulations, SAS macro programming, and R functions.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    Course Attributes:
    Mathematics

    MAT 7600 - Advanced Calculus
    Real numbers, completeness, sequences, limits, continuous functions, the derivative, sequences of functions, pointwise and uniform convergence, power series.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7605 - Topics in Analysis
    Advanced topics selected from real analysis, complex analysis, or higher analysis. Prerequisite: Determined by instructor.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7610 - Complex Analysis
    Complex numbers, analytic functions, Cauchy-Riemann equations, complex integration, Cauchy integral theorem and Cauchy integral formulae, power series, Taylor and Laurent series, singularities, residue theorem, harmonic functions.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7660 - Linear Algebra
    Vector spaces, linear transformations, eigenvalues and eigenvectors, invariant subspaces, decomposition theorem, Jordan forms, bilinear forms, selfadjoint operators, functions of operators, differential systems.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7670 - Mathematical Logic
    The sentential calculus, truth functions, analytic tableaux, natural deduction, first order logic, models, consistency, completeness. Applications to computer science including the P-NP problem.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7750 - Numerical Analysis I
    Error generation and propagation, root finding, approximation of functions by polynomials and cubic splines, direct and iterative solutions of linear systems, operations count, numerical differentiation and integration.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7755 - Numerical Analysis II
    Topics selected from: calculation of eigenvalues and eigenvectors, finite difference techniques, numerical methods for solving initial and boundary value problems, convergence, stability.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7770 - Number Theory
    Divisibility; Euclidean algorithm; prime numbers; Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic; congruences; arithmetic functions; Diophantine equations, additional topics, which may vary by semester, include cryptography, law of quadratic reciprocity, continued fractions.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7780 - Financial Mathematics
    Basic tools of financial markets; annuities; options; asset price random walks; estimation of parameters; Black-Scholes Model; implied volatility; portfolio-engineering; hedging; discrete models.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7790 - Dynamical Systems & Chaos
    Topics selected from: iteration of real and complex functions, population models, qualitative theory of differential equations, fractals and dimension, topological and metric properties of systems, and applications.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 7990 - Seminar in Biomathematics
    Supervised study and research project incorporating mathematical and computational models for topics such as: pattern detection and pattern matching in DNA sequences; population growth and the dynamics of epidemics.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Interdisciplinary

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8000 - Graduate Math Seminar

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Seminar

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8010 - Biomath Pedagogy Seminar
    Supervised study to develop, test, and implement an interdisciplinary instructional module for use in a high school curriculum. Module incorporates mathematical and computational models for topics such as: pattern detection and pattern matching in DNA sequences; population growth and the dynamics of epidemics.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Interdisciplinary

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8400 - Statistical Theory I
    Probability, random variables, univariate and multivariate distributions, mathematical expectation, Central Limit Theorem, Law of Large Numbers.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8401 - Statistical Theory II
    Sampling, estimation, hypothesis testing, decision theory, least squares, regression, analysis of variance, Bayesian statistics.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8406 - Regression Methods
    Linear regression, correlation, multiple regression, weighted least squares, residuals and influence diagnostics, model building, variable selection, nonlinear regression.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Nursing, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8408 - Multivariate Methods
    Multivariate normal distribution, principal component analysis, Hotelling T2 test, discriminant function analysis, multivariate analysis of variance, covariance and repeated measurements, canonical correlation analysis, factor analysis, claffication and cluster analysis.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8410 - Bayesian Statistics
    Prior distributions, Posterior distributions, Conjugate priors, the Metropolis-Hastings algorithm, the Gibbs sampler, Markov chain Monte Carlo, Convergence diagnostics, Credible Intervals Hierarchical modeling, Differences between Bayesian and frequentist inference.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8412 - Linear Models
    Analysis of general linear models, fixed and random effects, variance components, unbalanced data.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8414 - Categorical Data Anal
    Estimation, maximum likelihood, weighted least squares, log- linear models, logistic regression.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8416 - Design of Experiments
    Completely randomized, randomized block, latin square, nested, split plot, balanced incomplete block and crossover designs, factorials, systems of confounding, fractional factorials and response surface designs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8424 - Statistics Practicum
    Applications of regression analysis, analysis of variance, multivariate data analysis, presentation of results, statistical graphics, interpretation of results, issues relevant to the practice of statistical consulting. Analysis of a selected dataset, with written report and accompanying presentation required. Must have completed 24 credits in the Applied Statistics Program.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8430 - Operations Research
    Deterministic mathematical models, including linear programming, integer programming, inventory, transportation and assignment problems, networks and flows, nonlinear programming and dynamic programming with an emphasis on principles and techniques.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8435 - Mathematical Modeling
    Model construction, Markov chains, game theory, networks and flows, growth processes and models for epidemics and queues with an emphasis on model construction.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8440 - Statistics Quality Control
    Industrial applications of statistical techniques, Deming's 14 points, Ishikawa's charting techniques, control charts for attributes and variables, acceptance sampling, military standards, process capability studies, introduction to Taguchi designs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8444 - Time Series and Forecasting
    Frequency domain approaches to the analysis of time series, autoregressive models, forecasting.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8446 - Survival Data Analysis
    Analysis of survival of lifetime data; life tables and Kaplan-Meier estimation, survival analysis with covariates, Cox proportional hazard models.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8448 - Clinical Trials
    Basic principles of clinical trials, rationale, history, organization and planning, randomization and ethical issues, sample size determination, study designs: parallel, crossover, repeated measurements, statistical analysis of clinical trials data, interim analyses.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8450 - Longitudinal Data Analysis
    Longitudinal data plots, univariate and multivariate repeated measures, ANOVA, generalized linear models, response profile models, linear mixed models, generalized linear mixed models, residual diagnostics, missing data, clinical trials applications, analysis in SAS.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Mathematics and Statistics Department

    MAT 8452 - Nonparametric Statistics
    One sample rank tests, estimates and confidence intervals, paired replicates, two sample rank tests, nonparametric correlation and regression techniques.

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8100 - Leadership Challenge
    Intensive three day course focusing on the behavioral dimensions of decision making with an emphasis on the dynamics and challenges of creating a positive presence, influencing others, providing responsible leadership, and developing high performance teams.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Workshop

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8101 - Acctg Info Decision Making
    Elements of financial accounting and managerial accounting. Topics include the accounting cycle, working capital analysis, fixed assets, long term financing, financial statement analysis, budgeting, cost allocation, and performance measurement. Working knowledge of financial statements and use of data to make business decisions.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8110 - Management Accounting
    The role of management accounting in integrating corporate strategy, control, and accountability objectives. Topics include financial statement analysis, planning, strategic cost management, and performance measurement. Cases and/or group projects generally required.

    MBA 8140 - Customer Relationship Mgmt
    Discusses theoretic and practical issues related to implementation and use of CRM systems including: distinct functional areas (Sales Force Automation, Marketing Automation, Customer Support Centers) and their integration with tools like Salesforce.com and SAP's Integrated CRM package.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems, GB Marketing

    MBA 8141 - Dashboard Analytics
    Covers design and implementation of analytic dashboards in various functional areas. Topics include: underlying data sources, their integration into overall dashboard strategy and dashboard lifecycle from design to implementation of simple and advanced dashboards using Xcelsius and SAP's Business Objects.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems

    MBA 8142 - Bus Int: Lvrg the Val of Info
    Examines BI concepts/technologies from business user/analyst perspective. Covers transformation of data into valuable insights for decision making and how to use a BI tool to create applications and dashboards to support problem solving. Final project addresses real life business problem.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems

    MBA 8143 - Anatomy of Digital Comm.
    Encompassing both technical and managerial aspects of data communication, this course is designed to enhance student's understanding of how data communication works and to examine challenges and opportunities that confront today's technology-driven decision makers.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Schedule Types: Lecture

    GB MGT Information Systems

    MBA 8144 - Mobile Applications
    The emergence of today's highly-capable mobile devices is having a tremendous impact on modern business. Students will study the key technologies behind them and will also develop a prototype application and a business plan for implementing their project.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB MGT Information Systems

    MBA 8145 - Enterprise Info. Integration
    Examines enterprise information integration and data warehousing concepts and processes. Covers the basics of relational and dimensional data models and the approaches of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) to create an integrated information source for business intelligence and analytics.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB MGT Information Systems

    MBA 8146 - Simulation of Bus. Analytics
    Spreadsheet modeling course that studies real business decisions. Spreadsheet add-ins at Risk and Precision Tree will be used to allow the student to model applications in finance, marketing, and operations. The students will gain an understanding and appreciation for the uncertainty of values in certain cells and the significant impact that the uncertainty can have on decisions.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8147 - Analytics in Sports Business
    Discusses theory and application of how professional sports franchises gain competitive advantage through the integration of data analysis into their decision-making processes.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:

Discussions of financial and management accounting topics are integrated using a business process approach that links strategy, value chain activities, and performance outcome measurement.

    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8323 - Economics of Employment
    This course is aimed at modeling the use of optimal management practices contributing to emerging trends in HR. Specific topics to be discussed include: principal-agent theory, moral hazard, adverse selection, signaling and repeated games. Restricted to MBA Students and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8324 - Economic Anal. of Bus Strategy
    Provides the analytical framework for strategic decision making within the modern business firm. Topics covered include: horizontal and vertical boundaries of the firm, principal-agent problem, market structures, game theory and competitive advantage.

    MBA 8331 - Hltcare Econ: Patients-Policy
    Health care economics from the macroeconomic point of view, provides a framework for understanding the U.S. Health Care system in the global environment. Cost-benefit analysis will be included to analyze policy decisions.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8332 - Hlthcare Econ: Managr'l Perspc
    Health care economics at the microeconomic level of supply and demand. The providers of medical care (Medicare/ Medicaid/CHIP, private health insurance, physician services, hospitals, pharmaceuticals, and long-term care) and a detailed exploration of medical care production and costs.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8350 - Analyzing and Leveraging Data
    The course begins with a review of descriptive statistics, confidence intervals, and hypothesis testing. These tools will be extended into regression analysis geared towards analyzing large data sets in order to make informed business decisions.

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8401 - Corporate Finance
    Basic business problems and tools of financial decision- making, including present value techniques, capital- budgeting and cost of capital, asset management, introduction to the theory of portfolio management and capital asset pricing.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8410 - Applied Corporate Finance
    Application of theories and concepts of financial management to practical business problems and situations by means of case analysis and problem-solving techniques. Topics include valuation, risk and return relationships, working capital management, capital budgeting analysis, risk management, capital structure, and dividend policy.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8430 - Portfolio Management
    The structure and operation of domestic and international financial markets and institutions, including the flow of funds of savers to borrower, risk-return tradeoffs, market efficiency, asset pricing models, theories of interest rates, and term structure of interest rates. Research paper required.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8431 - Fixed Income Markets

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8432 - Corporate Restructuring
    Focuses on developing a set of analytical tools for corporate restructuring activities, especially Mergers and Acquisitions. Discusses managers' M&A motivations, strategies used in friendly vs. non-friendly takeovers and anti-takeover defense tactics. Includes discussion of costs and benefits of each strategy and methods for valuating a target firm.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    GB Finance

    MBA 8435 - Financial Statement Analysis
    This course provides a framework for business analysis and valuation using financial statement information. It incorporates relevant institutional and academic research results that are useful in applying the concepts. Case analyses are used to develop hands-on experiences. Written and oral case analysis are required.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8436 - Intro to Fin Derivatives
    A blend of theory and practice focusing on options and futures pricing models. Topics include structure of products and markets, development of hedging and speculative strategies, foreign currency and interest rate strategies. Computer applications and a research paper are required.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:

    The structure and operation of international financial markets and institutions, including the flow of funds from savers to borrowers, risk-return tradeoffs, market efficiency, asset pricing models, theories of interest rates, and term structure of interest rates. A research paper is required.

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8440 - Derv. & Risk Mgt. - Futures
    Mechanics of futures and forward markets; hedging and risk management techniques; forward and futures valuation models; interest rate and currency swaps; trading practices. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8441 - Deriv. & Risk Mgt - Options
    Mechanics of options markets; properties of stock options; hedging and risk management techniques; binomial trees; the Black-Scholes-Merton pricing model; trading strategies and practices. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8442 - Equity Markets & Valuation
    Risk and return; market efficiency; mechanics and structure of equity markets; equity trading strategies; financial statement ratio analyses; financial forecasting; valuation of common stocks. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8443 - Credit Markets & Valuation
    Valuation and risk characteristics of credit and credit derivatives markets. Valuation of corporate and treasury bonds; credit portfolio management; term structure of interest rates; credit risks; credit default swaps; and interest rate swaps. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8444 - Multinational Financial Mgmt.
    Globalization and the multinational corporation; foreign direct investment and political risk; international parity conditions; foreign exchange market; currency derivatives market; foreign exchange risk management; foreign trade financing; managing the multinational financial system. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary

    MBA 8445 - Corporate Restructuring
    Organizational and financial restructuring; ethical issues; goals of the firm; role of corporate governance; mergers and acquisitions; business combinations; merger waves; joint ventures; corporate alliances; valuation of public and private firms; negotiation strategies; leverage buyouts; IPOs; divestitures; takeovers; bankruptcy. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8446 - Mgmt. of Financial Instit.
    Measurement and management of risk; Sources of profitability and shareholder value; Role of financial markets and trading asset and liability management; impact of industry trends related to consolidation and regulation of financial institutions. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8447 - Portfolio Management
    Management of investment portfolios: diversification; risk management, portfolio insurance, performance evaluation and attribution; liquidity requirements; utility theory; and portfolio optimization algorithms. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8448 - Corporate Governance
    Course will cover the current state of corporate governance, the roles and responsibilities of shareholders, management, directors and other stakeholders and how corporate governance will evolve in the post global Financial Crisis world. MBA Students & JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8449 - International M&A
    Executives now lead in a "World is Flat" competitive environment. Course provides (i) a framework for understanding international M&A and strategic investing and (ii) expertise to serve as an effective business leader on such issues.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary

    MBA 8450 - Corporate Finance
    Tools and models used for making investment and financing decisions. Topics include valuation, risk and return, capital budgeting and cost of capital.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8451 - Financial Statement Analysis
    Develop skills for valuation and corporate strategic, business and investment analysis using financial statement data. Application to business world, corporate finance/investment banking, private equity, portfolio and investment management, owning your business, senior corporate leadership including treasury and controller functions.

    GB Finance

    MBA 8452 - Personal Finance

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8480 - Investments
    Covers the fundamentals of security analysis and valuation with a focus on equity investments. Holistic approach - applies both top-down and bottom-up valuation methods and introduces industry analysis and portfolio management techniques. Applied in nature, emphasizing how to put valuation theory into practice. Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance

    MBA 8481 - International Finance
    Corporations with activities that span multiple countries, also called multinational corporations (MNCs), face unique challenges and opportunities that purely domestic corporations do not face. In this course, students will learn the principles of international finance. This course adds an international dimension to the concepts previously learned learned in corporate finance. Students will be introduced to the historical and geographic environment of MNCs and financial institutions, the structure and operation of the foreign exchange markets, international monetary systems, international money and capital markets, derivatives markets, country risk evaluation, international portfolio diversification and international elements to project evaluation. This course will provide readings from the financial press.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    Distance Learning, GB Finance, GB International Business

    MBA 8490 - Independent Study - Finance

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Independent Study

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8502 - Statistical Analysis
    Descriptive and inferential statistics as applied to management problem solving and decisiion-making including descriptive statistics , probability theory, sampling, estimation, hypothesis testing, simple and multiple correlation and regression analysis, and time series.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    MBA DIT Course Division
    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8503 - Operations & Supply Chain Mgmt
    Concepts of operations management, operations technology, and the responsibilities of operation managers in the management of production systems, including problems and techniques of systems design, operation and control.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8505 - Business Ethics
    Ethical responsibilities of managers and corporations. Plausible frameworks for dealing with ethical dilemmas. Common patterns of sucess and failure in managing ethical conflicts. Critical evaluation of managerial and corporate ethics.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Law School, Undergraduate
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    MBA MGT Course Division
    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8506 - Employment Law
    This course is an in-depth analysis of the laws that regulate the workplace environment and determine the rights, responsibilities, and remedies available to both employers and employees. Each topic will be dealt with from both the perspective of management and the individual employee.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8510 - Leadership & Team Building
    The behavioral dimension of managerial action and decision making with emphasis on the dynamics and challenges of developing high performance teams and providing effective leadership. Exploration of business ethics, demographic diversity, motivation, communication, performance evaluation, conflict management, organizational change, and organizational learning in the global environment.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8515 - Dec Tech for Bus Applic
    Application of computer-based decision technologies to practical problems faced by business organizations. Theory and application of mathematical programming, decision analysis, and simulation. Self-directed team projects that are often implemented within students' own organizations. Software packages, including LINGO, Expert Choice, Excel, Stat::Fit, Extend, and web-based courseware, such as Lotus Learning Space.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8521 - Human Resource Management

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    MBA MGT Course Division
    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8522 - Talent Management
    Role of talent management in corporate strategy and success. Staffing, compensation, work design, performance measurement, individual and career development, safety, health, and separation. Focus on TM as critical success factor in organizations. Restricted to MBA Students and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing, Graduate Arts and Sciences

    GB Strategic Management

    GB International Business

    MBA 8524 - Total Quality Management
    Introduction to Total Quality Management Improvement philosophies, theories, and strategies as they apply to the business environment. Course will focus on application of improvement strategies to business problems faced by managers in public and private sectors.

    MBA 8526 - Leadership: Power & Influence
    Focus on use of legitimated power to influence individuals and teams for the achievement of organizational objectives. Theories of power and influence are discussed and cases are used to develop skill in the nuanced exercise of influence. Restricted to MBA Students and JDMBA Students.

    All Sections for this Course

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8530 - International Bus Management
    Provides an overview of economic and cultural integration, trade problems, and tariff barriers, and highlights the conflicts anhd compromises between the executive policies and national objectives of various countries. Emphasis is on the development of marketing strategies and the problems concerning overseas investment and financing.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8531 - Global Exporting: Asia Focus
    Investigates exporting as a key business strategy for entrepreneurial firms. Focus on opportunities in Asia with emphasis on critical success factors related to cultural norms, the meaning of contracts, and the role of government. Restricted to MBA Students and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8532 - Leading Change
    Focuses on leading change with emphasis on organizational mission and vision. Various approaches to organizational change evaluated for speed and long-term efficacy. Includes assessment of emotional intelligence and the development of exemplary leadership. Restricted to MBA Students and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8533 - Global Pharma: Latin America
    Investigates changes in the health care system with emphasis on the role of pharmaceutical companies. Topics studied include consolidation in "Big Pharma" and the role of pharma in emerging markets especially Central and South America. Restricted to MBA and JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Healthcare Administration, GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8534 - Analytics for Perf. Management
    Introduction to the field, development and use of data warehouses and data marts, key performance indicators, dashboards and scorecards for performance management, opportunity assessment, text and web mining, application of data mining techniques to decision making. MBA Students & JDMBA Students.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8535 - Being an Entrepreneur
    Covers personality issues, different types of entrepreneurship, skills needed and decision making in a chaotic environment. Taught from perspective of real entrepreneurs including a discussion of ethical issues. Designed to help students decide if this is right for them.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8536 - Challng of Ldrshp in Glob Orgs
    Successful global organizations require leaders to be collaborative and empowering, and transform organizations into adaptive and inclusive environments. This course covers specific challenges of leading multicultural organizations to prepare future leaders to understand and negotiate the complexities of such environments.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8537 - Intro to Data Mining
    Process of selecting, exploring, and modeling large amounts of data to uncover previously unknown patterns and gain insights. Several data mining techniques will be applied to large data sets from different business areas to support business decision making.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB MGT Information Systems, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8540 - Adv Performance Measurement
    Course explores corporate performance incentives, contemporary business measurement frameworks, world-class performance benchmarking, resource allocation decisions, and performance evaluation issues. Course further develops the analytical skills needed to integrate strategy, control and accountability and to understand how key business processes drive financial results.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8541 - Negotiation and Mediation
    Offered as a joint MBA and Law school elective, course is designed to develop advocacy skills for effective negotiation and mediation in transactional and dispute resolution contexts. Students will be required to review materials in negotiation and mediation theory and practice, and to participate in simulated exercises (both as parties and mediators) while confronting the practical, legal, and ethical dilemmas which often arise.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8542 - Global Social Entrepreneurship
    Course will examine the burgeoning, yet old, field that has billionaires pledging their wealth to spur innovation to solve the intractable problems of poverty and sickness among those at the bottom of the econimic pyramid. Much has been written on the past 10 years, and we will endeavor to understand its history, what it has become, what it is not, how we can each connect to it, and whether/how it will shape the global economy of the future.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8543 - Crisis Ldrshp: European Union
    Focus is on the unique challenges and opportunities that the European Union presents for business leaders. Will explore a broad range of issues, including the economic crises facing the EU; regulatory issues; the importance of SMEs as an economic growth engine; the goals of the Europe 2020 strategy; and the EU as a hub of global innovation, sustainability, and social responsibility.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8544 - The Entrepreneurial Process
    Examines new venture life cycles from launch to maturity, as well as start up marketing, resources, team building and growth management issues.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Engineering
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8545 - Change Management
    The objective of this course is to help students develop a framework in which to manage change. In order to accomplish this goal, you will be exposed to ideas supporting change theory and various change management models. The course discussion will teach you how to apply these ideas and tools in your role as a leader in your organization. We will use articles and case study examples to highlight the benefits and challenges of change management. The case studies will serve as examples of how change management appears, and can be managed, in various organizational contexts.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8546 - Opp. Recognition & Pre Launch
    Includes idea generation, opportunity development, planning and preparation. Also pre launch marketing, intellectual property, risk-reward analysis and first dollar start up funding. Introduces items to build in from the beginning such as lean, sustainability, and ethics standards.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8547 - Healthcare Economics
    Healthcare Economics broadly exams the totality of the U.S. health care system using the tools of microeconomics to assess varying health care markets. Special attention is paid to stakeholders, particularly patients, providers, and payers. Public health care policies are examined.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Healthcare Administration, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8548 - Public Sector Economics
    Overview of the economics of the public sector. Topics include the theories of public goods and optimal (efficient and equitable) taxation, public expenditures, revenues, and tax incidence.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8550 - Team Leadership & Grp Dynamics
    Course focuses on the behavioral dimension of managerial action and decision making with emphasis on group dynamics and interpersonal relationships. It includes an exploration of personal style, team leadership competencies, motivation, influencing others, communication, diversity, high performance teams, and learning in a global environment.

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Arts and Sciences

    MBA 8552 - Database Management
    Covers the role and application of databases in organizations, data modeling using the entity-relationship and semantic object models, and the relational data model and its implementation to SQL. Lectures and articles are combined with Access to solve cases.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8553 - Telecommunications Management
    Focuses on use of data communication technologies to support effective and efficient management of information in an organization. Topics covered: competing data telecommunications architectures and protocols, network topologies and technologies such as LAN, WAN, intranets and value-added networks.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8555 - E-Business
    Issues, advantages and disadvantages, and specific techniques involved in using electronic commerce to assist in the production, coordination, marketing and delivery of good and services.

    MBA 8560 - Strategic Dec Make & Exe Teams
    This course helps students understand the human decision-making process in the context of strategic issues faced by the executive team. We will research actual executive teams making strategic decisions.

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8561 - Negotiations
    The purpose of this experiential course is to understand and practice negotiation in a broad spectrum of business interactions faced by managers, consultants and other professionals. It is intended to enhance student negotiation skills.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8562 - Simulation of Bus Analytics
    Spreadsheet modeling course that studies real business decisions. Spreadsheet add-ins @Risk and Precision Tree will be used to allow the student to model applications in finance, marketing, and operations.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8563 - Bus Analytics Using Simulation
    This is a course in the use of the analytical techniques of discrete-event simulation to analyze and improve business processes. Arena Software will be used to allow the students to effectively solve complex business problems across multiple functional areas.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8564 - Stratg Desgn Think & Implement
    This course focuses on the intersection between design thinking methodologies and opportunity-finding for strategy development. It covers theory and practice related to innovation, complexity, emergence and principles of systems thinking.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8565 - Business Risk Management
    This course examines contemporary risk managment frameworks, overviews common regulatory reporting requirements, and provides practical insights on effective business risk management to help students navigate today's dynamic marketplace.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8580 - Intro to Business Analytics
    Provides an overview of the business analytics process and important analytic techniques; data visualization, data mining, optimization, and simulation. Exposes students to a variety of business problems in analytics (marketing, finance, operations). Throughout the course, students will learn to model and analyze complex business decisions with various tools on spreadsheets to improve decision making across business functions. Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics

    MBA 8581 - Executive Advancement
    Enriches understanding of the purpose/practice of executive decision-making. Topics and approaches to executive leadership in business development offer cutting-edge perspective on executive contributions to organizational performance. Builds on empirically supported theory to prepare students for active management. Heavy focus on recent issues/problems facing executives. Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8582 - Analytical Meth for Data Mng
    Data mining is the process of selecting, exploring, and modeling large amounts of data to uncover previously unknown patterns and gain insights. The objective of this course is to teach students how (and when) to use various techniques for mining data. Topics include logistic regression, decision tree networks, and neural networks. Students will mine large datasets from a variety of business areas and use their findings to support business decision making.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8601 - Decisions in Marketing

    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8630 - Importance of Emerging Markets
    This course will teach what process, strategic framework and philosophy one needs to have to effectively leverage the great potential of emerging markets. This course will also provide the guidance to critically evaluate the dynamics and characteristics of emerging markets as well as provide the guidance to identify the opportunities and the strategies to implement in order to be successful.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8631 - Exec Level Selling C-Suite
    Selling higher in organizations, often referred to as C-suite selling or up-tiering relationships, requires a unique mindset and a defined set of skills in order to gain a place at the executive table. Course focuses on where and how to start building a knowledge base, and with simulation and case studies will challenge the student to move from traditional, entry and mid-level selling to proficiency with clients at all senior levels within an organization.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing

    MBA 8632 - Cons Psy Optimal Bus Solutions
    Students will become "subject matter experts" on topics that impacts their professional lives. The format will be research-based and result in a detailed "full-immersion" presentation and consultancy exercise that demonstrates marketing and consumer behavior concepts combined with an analysis of a personal, corporate or agency strategic issue of interest to the students. Students will be exposed to in-class consultancy situations from corporate and governmental leaders and will analyze a business problem, provide a framework for analysis and qualified recommendations for action.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8640 - Marketing Communications
    Issues and challenges related to various marketing communications tools are examined through cases as well as concepts, principles and theoretical models.

    MBA 8642 - Applied Consumer Behavior
    Applying principles of consumer behavior to solve marketing problems; borrows from sociology/psychology and marketing/marketing research to analyze consumers' reactions to products/services; applies learning to brand management situations; real world marketing problems (cases and articles) as examples.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing

    MBA 8643 - Mgmt & Mkt of Services-Part I
    Analysis of unique challenges of marketing services compared to products; introduction to the expanded marketing mix (7 P's) and the Gaps Model of Service Quality; apply knowledge through case analysis.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Healthcare Administration, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8644 - Mgmt & Mkt of Services-Part II
    Builds on material from Services I, further exploring the Gaps Model of Service Quality. Major topics include communications and roles of employees and customers in service delivery. Case analysis will make the material relevant and topical.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Arts and Sciences

    MBA 8646 - Global Advertising & Promotion
    Building global brands through advertising and IMC; considers constraints such as culture, legal and political; effective use of promotion and current developments such as advertising in new media across markets are covered.

    MBA 8648 - Interactive Marketing
    Integrates knowledge about "direct marketing" and internet marketing into "interactive Marketing," (I/DM). Looks at key tenets of direct marketing - knowing, placing value on, and interacting with customers, a process aided by collection, processing, updating, and use of customer databases.

    All Sections for this Course

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8650 - Strategic Marketing Mgmt.
    Course focuses on the development, implementation and control of strategic marketing management decisions in complex environments designed to accomplish an organization's objectives. Theory and practice are utilized to develop integrated corporate strategies and detailed programs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Engineering, Graduate Arts and Sciences
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8651 - Brand Management
    Strategic approach to brand asset management in modern business entities; building and managing brands; understanding brand equity, how brands aid in segmentation, differentiation and positioning; frameworks for understanding brand strategy decisions, a brand's strengths, weaknesses and challenges; high-involvement class.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing

    MBA 8652 - Research Driven Dec. Making
    Basics of research design, sampling, survey design, analysis and interpretation; managerial focus; how to make informed decisions; employs actual industry research projects to further stress management's use of information/data to drive value-added decision-making in managing customer relationships.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing

    MBA 8653 - Global Strategy for Mkt. Entry
    Political, legal, economic, financial, social and cultural issues in successful conduct of global business; focus on market entry (how, timing); review organizational strucutre, leadership, labor relations, human resource considerations; develop marketing strategy to plan, organize, and implement foreign market entry.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB International Business, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing

    MBA 8654 - Mkting, Priv Eqty&Venture Cap
    Value creation forms the core of private equity and venture capital strategic development, this course explores marketing's role in this. Topics: 1) fundraising strategies 2) marketing strategies for venture acceleration and 3) marketing's role in deal valuation and operating company activities.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8655 - Mkting, Opprt Analy & Intl Bus
    Focuses on how corporate and governmental leaders may analyze their current environments (technological, regulatory, social/cultural, economic and competitive) to craft pro-growth agendas. Varied models and practices to identify, cultivate and convert opportunities in the global environment into measurable growth are discussed.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8656 - Cyber Security
    This course overview's the scope and nature of the cyber threat, developments in system and network security, business continuity and incident management, national and international approaches to cyber law and policy as well as threat mitigation strategies for organizations.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8657 - Getting Products to Market
    Identify and develop a product development process in getting a product to market within a corporate or start up environment. The process to include customer research development, prototype/test, iterate, measure and monitor.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8680 - Bldg Brands via Promo
    Examines the importance of branding to business, consumers, and society. Introduces the brand value chain as a framework for analyzing the impact of marketing expenditures on the bottom line. Emphasizes brand equity and outlines techniques for measurement. Focuses on how advertising and promotion enhance the brand building process. Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8681 - Digital Mkting & Social Media
    Examines how marketers can utilize emerging media (online, social and mobile) to promote customer engagement, enhance their traditional marketing mix, and measure the effectiveness of marketing efforts. Goal is to provide the theoretical understanding of the internet marketplace and equip students with skills needed to perform vital functions Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing

    MBA 8682 - Cons Psy Optimal Bus Solutions
    Introduces the student to the study of consumer behavior: how and why consumers and businesses act in a purchase environment. The structure will be similar to an executive briefing in which students become "subject matter experts" on a targeted consumer behavior topic based on instructor and executive guest speaker interactions. Attributes: GB Marketing

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Marketing, GB Strategic Management

    MBA 8683 - Marketing Research Tools
    Provides students with research and managerial perspectives in the application of marketing research tools. Hands-on approach allows students to learn how to construct qualitative and quantitative marketing research tools to understand concepts that range from brand affinity to consumer experience. Restricted to Graduate Business, Online Programs.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Analytics, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Marketing

    MBA 8684 - Global Marketing
    This course examines strategic elements of international marketing programs along with appropriate tactical elements designed to help firms implement strategy and thrive. Key topics include evaluating international market opportunities and coordination of strategy across markets. The application of marketing principles, along with an understanding of current trends affecting the marketing mix will be explored in depth. In addition, the multinational environment and cutural influences that complicate marketing programs will be emphasized.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    Distance Learning, GB International Business, GB Marketing

    MBA 8690 - Independent Study - Marketing

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8701 - Quant & Operations Analysis
    Application of quantitative methods in the analysis of operational problems in business organizations, including descriptive statistics, index numbers, estimation procedures, hypothesis testing, and regression and times series analysis. Detailed attention to technological issues in operations, capacity and aggregate production planning and supply chain management.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8710 - Info Tech as Strategic Lever
    Advances in IT provide an opportunity for business to leverage technology to rethink organizational strategy, structure, and process. Course provides an understanding of technology, organizational environment, and its effect on society.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8720 - Ethical Business Practices
    Ethical responsibilities of managers and corporations. Plausible frameworks for dealing with ethical dilemmas. Common patterns of success and failure in managing ethical conflicts. Critical evaluation of managerial and corporate ethics.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8730 - Mgmt. for Innov. & Creativity
    Study innovation processes at organizational system level. Develops students' awareness and confidence to innovate. Value of creativity tools and techniques for individual and group innovation. Students develop their own preferred creativity process and apply to individual and group challenges.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8740 - Global Political Economy
    International trade and production, global division of labor, environmental change, political economy governance, exchange rate implications, and consequences of globalization and production. International relations and organizations governing countries' trade relations.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business, Graduate Nursing
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8750 - Current Topics in Bus. Seminar
    This seminar style course will focus on a timely, important business issue. Various topics are offered each semester.

    0.250 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Seminar, Seminar, Seminar, Seminar

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8800 - Commercial Real Estate Invest.
    An overview of commercial real estate investment. Emphasis is on life cycle from acquisition through disposition using analytical and practical tools. Topics include market analysis, valuation, deal structuring, commercial leases, financing, investment management, marketing and careers in real estate.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8810 - Real Estate Fundamentals
    This course is the prerequisite for all other real estate courses and will cover basic commercial real estate concepts, foundational knowledge needed to understand the more advanced topics discussed in later electives.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8821 - Applied Commercial Real Estate
    Course is part II of the prerequisite for all real estate courses and will focus on valuation and also introduces aspects of real estate investment. The core of the course is a project in which students value an existing office building and present their findings to the class.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8822 - Sustainable RE Dev.-Part I
    Comprehensive course on the principles and processes of pre-development phases of real estate projects including land acquisition, legal, zoning, planning and approval perspective. Sustainable planning and engineering are an integral part of this course.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8823 - RE Securities & Capital Mkts
    Course will focus on public equity and debt markets related to real estate. Specific items to be discussed include: public equity markets (REITS), the mortgage back security markets, and hedge fund real estate strategies. Recommended prerequisite - Commercial Real Estate Investments.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8824 - Strateg. Real Estate Decisions
    The course uses real cases to analyze the strategic role of real estate in corporations. Students will be exposed to corporate real estate decisions from inception to implementation. Recommended prerequisite - Commercial Real Estate Investment.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8825 - Emerging Trends in RE
    This class will explore current trends in real estate development, their roots, how they ultimately affected the built environment and early trends that could impact future development.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8826 - Main Street Renewal
    Towns across America once revolved around cities, people shopped, worked, relaxed and worshipped. Municipal governments are seeking ways to rejuvenate these main streets. This course analyzes the future of small town USA changing in a vibrant and prosperous economic resurgence.

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8827 - Sustainable RE Development
    This course reflects on the principles and processes of development including land acquisition, legal, zoning, planning and approvals. An in-depth study of the sustainable development of offices, mixed use communities, residential and renovation projects. Emphasis is on understanding and evaluating through case studies the design, architecture, sustainability and financial analysis of real estate development.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8829 - Contemp. Topics in Real Estate

    1.500 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture, Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8830 - Sustainable RE Dev. I & II
    Sustainable Real Estate Development is a comprehensive course on the principles and processes of development including land acquisition, legal, zoning, planning and approvals. It includes an in-depth study of the sustainable development of offices, mixed use communities, residential and renovation projects. Case projects are a major component of this course. Emphasis is on understanding and evaluating through the case studies the design, architecture, sustainability and financial analysis real estate development.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Course Attributes:
    GB Finance, GB Multidisciplinary, GB Real Estate

    MBA 8900 - Strategic Management
    Strategic research and practices from the executive perspective, with emphasis on learning to formulate, implement, and control the strategic direction of a stakeholder-responsive organization within competitive markets and a global economy.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Lecture

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8910 - Soc. Enterp. Consulting Prac.
    This course is designed to give MBA students the opportunity to develop their professional skill set with a client firm that is serving the common good within the greater Philadelphia community. The focus is on strategic market management using a systems perspective within our Catholic and Augustinian tradition of supporting advancement of human dignity.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Practicum

    Master of Business Administ Department

    Global project in which student will incorporate all knowledge gained in the MBA program. Can be part of a global immersion (required for Fast Track) or done domestically.

    3.000 Credit hours

    Levels: Graduate Business
    Schedule Types: Practicum

    Master of Business Administ Department

    MBA 8930 - Global Strategic Management
    Strategic decision-making from the executive perspective, with emphasis on learning to formulate, implement, and control the strategic direction of a stakeholder-responsive organization within competitive markets and a global economy.
